attributes.action: apologise for his role in the recession
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Whilst we accept that some despise Mr Brown and attempt to portray him responsible for everything, we do not.
What we do recognise, is that his govt. when it came in, said an end to the boom and bust economy.
We have had one of the biggest booms, and correspondigly, one of the biggest busts that is not a minor blip, but a full scale recession.
Again, we do recognise, some of this is global, we are reasonable, but much CAN be attributed directly to direct policy or lack of thereof, ie. complacency and unwilling to listen to wise people instead of mandarins who in reality know little.
So we ask the PM to apologise for his role as chancellor in busting Britain, which he is PARTLY culpable, in line that some of the cabinet are calling for this, now as well, ie Ed Balls, and Mr Darling.
